column4: here is a simple poser for any one who can answer. i recently installed 9.04 on  COMPAQ EVO n610c laptop with built in ATI mobility graphics, after updating to the new recommended driver and catalyst. now when i reboot the screen is garbled and unusable. is there a way to enter a safe graphics mode so i can undo those changes?
boot in recovery mode. you can tap esc key during boot to get that option in grub menu
i typically just use the open driver for ati. i find it very good for 2d stuff
thanks, i will try that, i didnt know how it was done, i am still noob sauce to linux
